column4: sorry, I was trying to read what you were saying earlier but lost the backscroll what is the "DISABLED OPTIONS thing"
if the wrong nvidia kernel modules is being loaded, it's a way to force the right one to be
what is the command?
in /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common, set DISABLED_MODULES="nvidia_legacy nvidia_new"
as near as I can tell that is my error... I tried to overwrite it with the drivers from nvidias site but it is still not working correctly...
or use nvidia instead of nvidia_new
if you're using the 9755 driver
should I assume the install went bad and try again... or is this kind of thing pretty common?
if you're going to use the nvidia installer, you need DISABLED_MODULES="nv"

okay I got a little lost, but I got x to start.... I used the driver "nv" in my xorg.conf after doing a sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new and setting DISABLED_MODULES to "nvidia_legacy nv"-- I am sure I have done something wrong but it is working ;)
I think you're using a mix of the nvidia installer and the ubuntu packages though
that seems bad.. right/
so it may break when the next kernel upgrade happens
no it's not that big of a deal though since they're the same version
well I just installed, would you recommend reinstalling and starting again with my sanity hat on?
only if you want to :)
well I think I may... it seems like a good time for it... and now I think I can go from scratch without a bunch of weird stuff... that was always the problem with my dapper install :)
still around?
yep
I reinstalled and eveything worked out of the box...
the only thing I did differently was I didn't enable the restricted mode drivers during nstall the second time... I think that causes things to not work...
